sub_topic: Show that every group of order 8 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C8, the quaternion group Q8, or the dihedral group D4.
message_1: How many groups of order 8 are there that are isomorphic to either the cyclic group C8, the quaternion group Q8, or the dihedral group D4?
message_2:
There is exactly one group of order 8 that is isomorphic to each of the mentioned groups:

1. Cyclic group C8: There is only one cyclic group of order 8, which is generated by an element of order 8.

2. Quaternion group Q8: There is only one quaternion group of order 8, which has elements {±1, ±i, ±j, ±k} with specific multiplication rules.

3. Dihedral group D4: There is only one dihedral group of order 8, which represents the symmetries of a square.

So, there are a total of 3 groups of order 8 that are isomorphic to either C8, Q8, or D4.
